briefdescription.para: TRUE if the byte need not be escaped when found in a dbus address.

detaileddescription.para: All other bytes are required to be escaped in a valid address.

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusError *error, const char *address_problem_type, const char *address_problem_field, const char *address_problem_other)
memberdef.name: _dbus_set_bad_address

detaileddescription.para: If address_problem_type and address_problem_field are not NULL, sets an error message about how the field is no good. Otherwise, sets address_problem_other as the error message.

parameterdescription.para: the address type of the bad address or NULL
the missing field of the bad address or NULL
any other error message or NULL

briefdescription.para: Appends an escaped version of one string to another string, using the D-Bus address escaping mechanism.
Frees a NULL-terminated array of address entries.
Returns the method string of an address entry.

detaileddescription.para: For example, given the address entry "tcp:host=example.com" it would return the string "tcp"

simplesect.para: a string describing the method. This string must not be freed.

briefdescription.para: Returns a value from a key of an entry.

detaileddescription.para: For example, given the address "tcp:host=example.com,port=8073" if you asked for the key "host" you would get the value "example.com"
The returned value is already unescaped.

simplesect.para: the key value. This string must not be freed.

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusString *unescaped, const DBusString *escaped, int escaped_start, int escaped_len, DBusError *error)
memberdef.name: append_unescaped_value

briefdescription.para: Parses an address string of the form:

detaileddescription.para: See the D-Bus specification for complete docs on the format.
When connecting to an address, the first address entries in the semicolon-separated list should be tried first.

parameterdescription.para: return location to an array of entries.
address where an error can be returned.

briefdescription.para: Escapes the given string as a value in a key=value pair for a D-Bus address.

simplesect.para: newly-allocated escaped value or NULL if no memory

briefdescription.para: Unescapes the given string as a value in a key=value pair for a D-Bus address.

detaileddescription.para: Note that dbus_address_entry_get_value() returns an already-unescaped value.

parameterdescription.para: error to set if the unescaping fails

simplesect.para: newly-allocated unescaped value or NULL if no memory
